candidates.title: `chrono` replaced with `time`,  `local_offset` feature flag added
candidates.body:
* `chrono` has been replace with `time` as the `time` crate is better maintained.
* Added a `local_offset` feature flag.  Using this will enable the local timezone features in the `git` and `build` features.  However, due to a [potential segfault](https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/blob/main/crates/time/RUSTSEC-2020-0071.md) in the `time` crate, you must also explicitly opt in to the unsoundness by setting `RUSTFLAGS="--cfg unsound_local_offset"`.   Per the `time` crate docs, this is untested, so use with extreme caution.

candidates.title: Don't require old time dependency
candidates.body: A default feature in Chrono pulls in `time` v0.1, which is completely unnecessary for this crate, and on top of that currently it's marked by rustsec as vulnerable and unfixable.

candidates.title: Pin `sysinfo` to 0.19 to avoid msrv 1.54 for now
Pin `sysinfo` to the lowest supported version
candidates.body:
* Pin `sysinfo` to 0.19

Fixes #80

candidates.title: v5.1.6
candidates.body: * Release branch

candidates.title: Disable the Rayon dep for sysinfo
candidates.body:
With default features sysinfo will pull in rayon, which isn't very nice for build times.

build.rs scripts aren't supposed to use more than one CPU anyway, see https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/build-scripts.html#jobserver

candidates.title: `rustc_version` to 0.3.1
candidates.body:
* Updated to 0.3.1.

Fixes #65

candidates.title: v5.1.1
candidates.body: * Better cfg attribute names

candidates.title: v5.1.0
candidates.body: * Added `sysinfo` support

candidates.title: Add `sysinfo` support
candidates.body: * Add `sysinfo` feature to allow access to machine specific data that may be useful as build time data

candidates.title: v5.0.1
candidates.body: * Version bump for 5.0.1

candidates.title: Make some loose versions in Cargo.toml slightly more accurate
candidates.body:
A number of the versions in Cargo.toml were pretty loose (e.g. `"0"`) and I was fairly sure that at least some of them weren't accurate (I knew that `serial_test` almost certainly wasn't). A bit of experimentation later, I've found a series of them that didn't work with the lowest versions that were valid for the listed ranges, and inserted some more precise ranges (while still trying to keep the flexibility where valid).

In theory this could be automatically tested with `cargo +nightly build  -Z minimal-versions` but you end up with issues like early versions of `libssh2-sys` having hyphenated names and having to add a bunch of extra "no, not that version" checks to make it work sadly.

candidates.title: Added a `cargo` feature to expose some cargo env variable
candidates.body: * There are a handful of cargo variable that are only set a environment variables for build scripts (https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/environment-variables.html#environment-variables-cargo-sets-for-build-scripts).  This features writes vergen cargo instructions for the target triple, the profile, and enable features.

candidates.title: v4.0.3
candidates.body: * Bumped the patch version for release

candidates.title: fix: Require rustc_version ^0.3.1
candidates.body:
### Description

Requires `rustc_version` to be at least 0.3.1 in order to prevent the following error if another dependency uses an older version of `rustc_version`.  The `llvm_version` field on `rustc_version::VersionMeta` was added in rustc_version `0.3.1`.

```
error[E0609]: no field `llvm_version` on type `VersionMeta`
  --> /home/drk/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/vergen-4.0.2/src/feature/rustc.rs:79:42
   |
79 |             if let Some(llvmver) = rustc.llvm_version {
   |                                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^ unknown field
   |
   = note: available fields are: `semver`, `commit_hash`, `commit_date`, `build_date`, `channel` ... and 2 others

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0609`.
error: could not compile `vergen`
```

### Tested

Following tests passes.

```bash
cargo fmt
cargo clippy --all
cargo build-all-features
cargo test-all-features
```

candidates.body: This fixes #36 by disabling the `git2` features that rely on `openssl-sys`, since it looks like we're not actually using any of them in this crate :)

candidates.title: Removed deprecated code generation.  Codegen wasn't 100% safe.
candidates.body:
Removed the deprecated code generation.   There was a chance that any rust code could be introduced into the generated file.   As this was all deprecated in 2.0, I have just removed the deprecated code.

Fixes #26

* Added a `local_offset` feature flag.  Using this will enable the local timezone features in the `git` and `build` features.  However, due to a [potential segfault](https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/blob/main/crates/time/RUSTSEC-2020-0071.md) in the `time` crate, you must also explicitly opt in to the unsoundness by setting `RUSTFLAGS="--cfg unsound_local_offset"`.   Per the `time` crate docs, this is untested, so use with extreme caution.
